Column Comment.0: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: This column is used to enforce the relationship betweenLAND RIGHT and its subtypes. The value must be equal to the name of one of thevalid subtypes: LAND_AGREEMENT, LAND_AGREE_PART, LAND_LEASE,LAND_GRANTED_RIGHT, LAND_UNIT, LAND_UNIT_TRACT or LAND_TITLE.
Column Comment.1: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, aquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.2: PROVIDED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate,such as a person, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium whoprovided this service.
Column Comment.3: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: This column is added toallow a business associate to offer the same service off and on over a period of time.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SERVICE TYPE: A valid list of services for a businessassociate. For example well logger, drilling contractor, application developer. Forland, may be may be address for service, brokerage, maintainor etc.
Column Comment.6: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the person who provides a contact for thecompletion of this service.
Column Comment.7: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.8: DESCRIPTION: text description of the service that was provided.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: SERVICE END DATE: the date that this service was completed.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ORGANIZATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for anorganization of a company or organization.
Column Comment.13: ORGANIZATION SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique number added to alloworganizations to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: PROVIDED FOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thebusiness associate that this service is provided for. For example, may be used incases where the responsible party may third party a necessary service.
Column Comment.16: PROVISION IDENTIFIER: Unique code identifying the provision in the contract.(could be same as clause number e.g. 16 or entered as 16 even though clause isactually numbered XVI - facilitates easier query)
Column Comment.17: RATE AND FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided. .
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.19: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.20: SERVICE QUALITY: A code indicating the quality of service received from thisBUSINESS ASSOCIATE, either at a specified address, or for a specific service.
Column Comment.21: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.22: SERVICE START DATE: Date service was provided
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
